result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas E. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
----------------------------------------------

Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
------------------------------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
-------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
-------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
----------------------------------------

timeConds.notes:
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 
---------------------------------------

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court. 
---------------------------------------

May transfer jail to Racine County
---------------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas E. Larson

defendant.name: Larson, Nicholas E.
defendant.address: 200 W. Northwater St., Silver Lake, WI 53170

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas E. Larson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E. Keizer in court for Nicholas E. Larson.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant plead guilty to count # 1. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court gives warning to deportation. Defendant does not make statement. Jury Trial cancelled. Court sentences defendant. Minutes filed.
Certified Copy Letter from DA to Walworth County Clerk of Courts

Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nicholas E. Larson not in court.  Attorney Kathryn E. Keizer in court for Nicholas E. Larson.   
Offer was received. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:31 am.
Application for Jail Time Credit form
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 21CM753 & 22CM285

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH T.R. OR HER RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Case called at 241 pm. Defendant in court with Atty Kathryn Keizer. ADA Crawford appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter on for initial appearance on 22cm285. NG plea entered. Underlying bond to cover this file. FPT for 21CM753. Atty Keizer just appointed and not ready to proceed. ADA TenHaken has not objected to continuance. ADA Crawford confirms. Trial to be removed. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Parties believe they can come to a resolution. Court set matter over for a status in 45 days.
Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
